utils/fcamVignette.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 
00002 // Simple utility that characterizes the vignetting on an FCam sensor/lens using a 10th0order radial polynomial
00003 // This is the characterization used by the DNG spec as well.
00004 
00005 #if !defined(FCAM_VERSION)
00006 #define FCAM_VERSION "x.x.x"
00007 #endif
00008 
00009 #include <FCam/FCam.h>
00010 #include "LinearAlgebra.h"
00011 #include <stdio.h>
00012 #include <unistd.h>
00013 #include <cmath>
00014 
00015 void usage() {
00016     printf("fcamVignette\n"
00017            "  (FCam version " FCAM_VERSION ")\n"
00018            "  A simply utility to characterize camera vignetting for\n"
00019            "  the FCam API.\n\n"
00020 
00021            "Usage: fcamVignette [-o OUTPUT] INPUT1.dng INPUT2.dng ... INPUTN.dng \n"
00022            "  Takes in raw image(s) INPUT.dng and outputs polynomial coefficients for\n"
00023            "  its vignetting function.\n"
00024            "  The input image(s) need to be of a single color, uniformly illuminated\n"
00025            "  object that fills the whole field of view. Examples are:\n"
00026            "   1. A white sheet of paper uniformly lit photographed straight-on.\n"
00027            "   2. Cloudless sky straight above (the horizon might have some color shifts).\n"
00028            "\n"
00029            "  The image(s) should have no overexposed sections and the histogram.\n"
00030            "  should be centered at about 1/2-2/3 max luminance.\n"
00031            "  Multiple input images will be averaged together before estimation to reduce noise\n"
00032            "\n");
00033     exit(1);
00034 }
00035 
00036 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00037     if (argc < 2) {
00038         usage();
00039     }
00040 
00041     bool saveCorrected = false;
00042     std::string outputFile;
00043 
00044     const char *options="o:";
00045     
00046     int argChar;
00047     while (  (argChar = getopt(argc,argv,options)) != -1) {
00048         switch (argChar) {
00049         case 'o':
00050             outputFile = std::string(optarg);
00051             saveCorrected = true;
00052             break;
00053         case '?':
00054             usage();
00055             break;
00056         }
00057     }
00058 
00059     if (optind == argc) {
00060         printf("!! Error: No input file given!\n\n");
00061         usage();
00062     }
00063 
00064     // Load input files
00065 
00066     FCam::Image flatImg;
00067     FCam::Frame flatField;
00068 
00069     int xOffset = 0;
00070     int yOffset = 0;
00071 
00072     int inputs = 0;
00073     for (int i = optind; i < argc; i++) {
00074         inputs++;
00075 
00076         std::string inputFile(argv[i]);
00077         
00078         printf("Reading %s...\n", inputFile.c_str());
00079         flatField = FCam::loadDNG(inputFile);
00080         
00081         FCam::Event e;
00082         if (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00083             printf("  Events reported while loading %s:\n", inputFile.c_str());
00084             do {
00085                 switch (e.type) {
00086                 case FCam::Event::Error:
00087                     printf("    Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00088                 break;
00089             case FCam::Event::Warning:
00090                 printf("    Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00091                 break;
00092             default:
00093                 printf("    Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00094                 break;
00095             }
00096             } while(getNextEvent(&e));
00097         }
00098         
00099         if (!flatField.valid()) {
00100             printf("!! Error: Unable to read input file %s\n", inputFile.c_str());
00101             exit(1);
00102         }
00103 
00104         // Crop image to adjust it to GRBG Bayer pattern (arbitrary choice)
00105         
00106         int w = flatField.image().width();
00107         int h = flatField.image().height();
00108                  
00109         FCam::Image curFlatImg;
00110         switch (flatField.platform().bayerPattern()) {
00111         case FCam::RGGB:
00112             curFlatImg = flatField.image().subImage(1, 0, FCam::Size(w, h));
00113             xOffset = 1;
00114             break;
00115         case FCam::BGGR:
00116             curFlatImg = flatField.image().subImage(0, 1, FCam::Size(w, h));
00117             yOffset = 1;
00118             break;
00119         case FCam::GRBG:
00120             curFlatImg = flatField.image();
00121             break;
00122         case FCam::GBRG:            
00123             curFlatImg = flatField.image().subImage(1, 1, FCam::Size(w, h));
00124             xOffset = yOffset = 1;
00125             break;
00126         default:
00127             printf("Can't handle unknown or non-Bayer raw files. Sorry!\n");
00128             exit(1);
00129             break;
00130         }
00131         
00132         if (!flatImg.valid()) {
00133             flatImg = curFlatImg;
00134         } else {
00135             if (flatImg.size() != curFlatImg.size()) {
00136                 printf("!! Input images are of different sizes\n");
00137                 exit(1);
00138             }
00139             for (unsigned int y=0; y < flatImg.height(); y++) {
00140                 for (unsigned int x=0; x < flatImg.width(); x++) {
00141                     *(unsigned short *)flatImg(x,y) += *(unsigned short*)curFlatImg(x,y);
00142                 }
00143             }
00144         }
00145     }
00146 
00147     int w = flatImg.width();
00148     int h = flatImg.height();
00149     
00150     if (inputs > 1) {
00151         for (int y=0; y < h; y++) {
00152             for (int x=0; x < w; x++) {
00153                 *(unsigned short *)flatImg(x,y) /= inputs;
00154             }
00155         }
00156     }
00157 
00158     // Sanity check input file sum to make sure it's not a lousy flatfield
00159 
00160     float saturationFraction = 0.9f;
00161     float darknessFraction = 0.1f;
00162     // Green channel only
00163     int maxRaw = flatField.platform().maxRawValue();
00164     int minRaw = flatField.platform().minRawValue();
00165     int saturationCutoff = saturationFraction*(maxRaw-minRaw)+minRaw;
00166     int darknessCutoff = darknessFraction*(maxRaw-minRaw)+minRaw;
00167     int saturationCount = 0;
00168     int darknessCount = 0;
00169     int colAvgSum = 0;
00170     float colAvgBgRatioSum = 0;
00171     float colAvgBgRatioSqSum = 0;
00172     float colAvgRgRatioSum = 0;
00173     float colAvgRgRatioSqSum = 0;
00174 
00175     for (int y =0; y < h; ++y) {
00176         int rowSum = 0;
00177         float bgRatioSum = 0;
00178         float bgRatioSqSum = 0;
00179         float rgRatioSum = 0;
00180         float rgRatioSqSum = 0;
00181 
00182         int xStart = y % 2;
00183         for (int x =xStart; x < w; x=x+2) {
00184             rowSum += *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y) - minRaw;
00185             float green = *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y) - minRaw;
00186             if (green < 1) green = 1;
00187             if (y % 2) {
00188                 // Blue row
00189                 float blue = *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x-1,y) - minRaw;
00190                 float bgRatio = blue/green;
00191                 bgRatioSum += bgRatio;
00192                 bgRatioSqSum += bgRatio*bgRatio;
00193             } else {
00194                 // Red row
00195                 float red = *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x+1,y) - minRaw;
00196                 float rgRatio = red/green;
00197                 rgRatioSum += rgRatio;
00198                 rgRatioSqSum += rgRatio*rgRatio;
00199             }
00200 
00201             if (*(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y) > saturationCutoff) ++saturationCount;
00202             if (*(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y) < darknessCutoff) ++darknessCount;
00203         }
00204         colAvgSum += rowSum / (w/2);
00205         if (y % 2) {
00206             //printf("%.4f %.4f\n", bgRatioSum / (w/2), bgRatioSqSum / (w/2));
00207             colAvgBgRatioSum += bgRatioSum / (w/2);
00208             colAvgBgRatioSqSum += bgRatioSqSum / (w/2);
00209         } else {
00210             //printf("%.4f %.4f    ", rgRatioSum / (w/2), rgRatioSqSum / (w/2));
00211             colAvgRgRatioSum += rgRatioSum / (w/2);
00212             colAvgRgRatioSqSum += rgRatioSqSum / (w/2);
00213         }
00214     }
00215     int roughAvg = colAvgSum / h;
00216     float bgRatioAvg = colAvgBgRatioSum / (h/2);
00217     float bgVariance = colAvgBgRatioSqSum / (h/2) - bgRatioAvg*bgRatioAvg;
00218     float bgStdDev = std::sqrt(bgVariance);
00219     float rgRatioAvg = colAvgRgRatioSum / (h/2);
00220     float rgVariance = colAvgRgRatioSqSum / (h/2) - rgRatioAvg*rgRatioAvg;
00221     float rgStdDev = std::sqrt(rgVariance);
00222 
00223     printf("Some statistics for the average input image:\n");
00224     printf(" %% Pixels more than %.0f%% of max raw value: %.2f\n", saturationFraction*100, 100*(float)saturationCount / (w*h) );
00225     printf(" %% Pixels less than %.0f%% of max raw value: %.2f\n", darknessFraction*100, 100*(float)darknessCount / (w*h) );
00226     printf(" Rough average value/max raw value: %d/%d (%f)\n", roughAvg, maxRaw-minRaw, (float)roughAvg/(maxRaw-minRaw) );
00227     printf(" Blue-green ratio average: %.2f, standard deviation: %.2f\n", bgRatioAvg, bgStdDev);
00228     printf(" Red-green ratio average: %.2f, standard deviation: %.2f\n", rgRatioAvg, rgStdDev);
00229     printf("\n");
00230 
00231     if (saturationCount * 20 > w*h) {
00232         printf("!! Warning: At least 5%% of the image is close to saturation - vignette fit may be poor\n");
00233     }
00234     if (saturationCount * 20 > w*h) {
00235         printf("!! Warning: At least 5%% of the image is close to black - vignette fit may be poor\n");
00236     }
00237     if (roughAvg < (maxRaw - minRaw)/4 ) {
00238         printf("!! Warning: Average green value is less than quarter of maximum - vignette fit may be poor\n");
00239     }
00240     if (bgStdDev > 0.2 || rgStdDev > 0.2) {
00241         printf("!! Warning: The image seems to have quite a bit of color tone variation - is it really an image of nothing but a solid color?\n");
00242     }
00243 
00244     // Quadratic fit to find optical center, green channel only
00245     // Finding least-squares fit for the model
00246     // i_vignette(x,y) = i_flat(x,y) * (k0 + k1*x + k2*y + k3*(x^2+y^2) )
00247     // which is a radial symmetric 2nd-order polynomial with an arbitrary centerpoint
00248     
00249     printf("\nFinding vignetting parameters...\n");
00250 
00251     ImageStack::LeastSquaresSolver<4, 1> centerFit;
00252     double coordNormalizer = 2.f/std::sqrt(w*w+h*h); // Keep coefficients near 1.0
00253     double centerXn = w/2*coordNormalizer;
00254     double centerYn = h/2*coordNormalizer;
00255     for (int y =0; y < h; ++y) {
00256         for (int x = y % 2; x < w; x=x+2) {
00257             double coord[4];
00258             coord[0] = 1;
00259             coord[1] = x * coordNormalizer;
00260             coord[2] = y * coordNormalizer;
00261             coord[3] = coord[1]*coord[1]+coord[2]*coord[2];
00262 
00263             double xn, yn, weight;
00264             xn = coord[1]-centerXn;
00265             yn = coord[2]-centerYn;
00266             weight = std::sqrt(xn*xn+yn*yn); // Weight center pixels less than edge pixels, since the center is very flat
00267 
00268             double p;
00269             p = *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y);
00270 
00271             centerFit.addCorrespondence(coord, &p, weight);            
00272         }
00273     }
00274     
00275     double kC[4];
00276     if (!centerFit.solve(kC)) {
00277         printf("Error: Can't perform a least-squares fit on the image, for some odd reason.\n");
00278         exit(1);
00279     }
00280 
00281     float cx = -kC[1]/(2*kC[3]*coordNormalizer);
00282     float cy = -kC[2]/(2*kC[3]*coordNormalizer);
00283 
00284     printf("\nOptical center:\n  (%.2f, %.2f)\n", cx + xOffset, cy + yOffset);
00285 
00286     // Now do a full solve for the 10th-order even radial polynomial:
00287     // m_x = max( |0-cx|, |w-cx-1| );
00288     // m_y = max( |0-cy|, |h-cy-1| );
00289     // m = sqrt( m_x^2 + m_y^2 );
00290     // r = sqrt( (x - cx)^2 + (y - cy)^2 ) / m;
00291     // i_vignette(x,y) = i_flat(x,y) * (k0 + k1*r^2 + k2*r^4 + k3*r^6 + k4*r^8 + k5*r^10);
00292     ImageStack::LeastSquaresSolver<6, 1> fullFit;
00293     double m_x = std::max( std::fabs(0-cx), std::fabs(w-1-cx));
00294     double m_y = std::max( std::fabs(0-cy), std::fabs(h-1-cy));
00295     double invMsq = 1/( m_x*m_x + m_y*m_y);
00296     
00297     for (int y =0; y < h; ++y) {
00298         for (int x = y % 2; x < w; x=x+2) {
00299             double radPowers[6];
00300             radPowers[0] = 1;
00301             radPowers[1] = invMsq * ((x - cx)*(x - cx) + (y - cy)*(y - cy)); // r^2
00302             radPowers[2] = radPowers[1]*radPowers[1]; // r^4 
00303             radPowers[3] = radPowers[2]*radPowers[1]; // r^6
00304             radPowers[4] = radPowers[2]*radPowers[2]; // r^8
00305             radPowers[5] = radPowers[3]*radPowers[2]; // r^10
00306 
00307             double weight;
00308             weight = radPowers[1]; // Weight edge pixels more than center ones
00309 
00310             double p;
00311             p = *(unsigned short*)flatImg(x,y);
00312 
00313             fullFit.addCorrespondence(radPowers, &p, weight);
00314         }
00315     }    
00316 
00317     double k[6];
00318     if (!fullFit.solve(k)) {
00319         printf("Error: Can't perform a least-squares fit on the image, for some odd reason.\n");
00320         exit(1);
00321     }
00322 
00323     // Normalize constant coefficient to 1
00324 
00325     k[1] = k[1]/k[0];
00326     k[2] = k[2]/k[0];
00327     k[3] = k[3]/k[0];
00328     k[4] = k[4]/k[0];
00329     k[5] = k[5]/k[0];
00330 
00331     cx += xOffset; // Fix for possible cropping earlier
00332     cy += yOffset;
00333 
00334     printf("\nPolynomial fit:\n");
00335     printf("  1 + %.4f r^2 + %.4f r^4 + %.4f r^6 + %.4f r^8 + %.4f r^10\n",
00336            k[1], k[2], k[3], k[4], k[5]);
00337 
00338     printf("\nCoefficients (DNG spec notation):\n");
00339     printf("  cx_hat = %f\n", cx/(w-1));
00340     printf("  cy_hat = %f\n", cy/(h-1));
00341     printf("  k0 = %f\n", k[1]);
00342     printf("  k1 = %f\n", k[2]);
00343     printf("  k2 = %f\n", k[3]);
00344     printf("  k3 = %f\n", k[4]);
00345     printf("  k4 = %f\n", k[5]);
00346 
00347     if (saveCorrected) {
00348         std::string inputFile(argv[argc-1]);
00349 
00350         printf("\nCorrecting input image %s, writing to %s\n", inputFile.c_str(), outputFile.c_str());
00351         
00352         flatField = FCam::loadDNG(inputFile);
00353         
00354         FCam::Event e;
00355         if (getNextEvent(&e)) {
00356             printf("  Events reported while loading %s:\n", inputFile.c_str());
00357             do {
00358                 switch (e.type) {
00359                 case FCam::Event::Error:
00360                     printf("    Error code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00361                     break;
00362                 case FCam::Event::Warning:
00363                     printf("    Warning code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.data, e.description.c_str());
00364                     break;
00365                 default:
00366                     printf("    Event type %d, code: %d. Description: %s\n", e.type, e.data, e.description.c_str());
00367                     break;
00368                 }
00369             } while(getNextEvent(&e));
00370         }
00371         
00372         if (!flatField.valid()) {
00373             printf("!! Error: Unable to read input file %s for correction\n", inputFile.c_str());
00374             exit(1);
00375         }
00376 
00377         for (int y=0; y < h; y++) {
00378             for (int x=0; x < w; x++) {
00379                 float radPowers[6];
00380 
00381                 radPowers[1] = invMsq * ((x - cx)*(x - cx) + (y - cy)*(y - cy));
00382                 radPowers[2] = radPowers[1]*radPowers[1];
00383                 radPowers[3] = radPowers[2]*radPowers[1];
00384                 radPowers[4] = radPowers[2]*radPowers[2];
00385                 radPowers[5] = radPowers[3]*radPowers[2];
00386                 
00387                 *(unsigned short*)flatField.image()(x,y) /= 
00388                     1 + k[1]*radPowers[1] + k[2]*radPowers[2] 
00389                       + k[3]*radPowers[3] + k[4]*radPowers[4]
00390                       + k[5]*radPowers[5];
00391             }
00392         }
00393 
00394         FCam::saveDNG(flatField, outputFile);
00395     }
00396 
00397     printf("\n\nDone.\n");
00398 }
